author: Odeinoichus
title: Wizards Appear in LEGO Dimensions
review:
Set #71247 Harry Potter Team Pack: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them is not the only part of the Wizarding World we get to explore in LEGO Dimensions. Alas it is the only one featuring any levels, Harry Potter is represented by three characters, a Team Pack and a Fun Pack. This unlocks a new Adventure World, but sadly we do not get to re-visit any iconic moments in the franchise for a new level. Still though this is a nice pack.

Packaging

The standard Team Pack packaging is used to great effect, the images on the front show a nighttime profile of Hogwarts Castle while the two iconic enemies face off in what could be their final duel. The back shows a lovely image of the Adventure World, giving you a sense of what to expect.

Parts

Here we find a lot of red and blue elements with black and red thrown in for good measure. I don’t believe I’ve ever mentioned this before, but the extent of most parts in most packs from LEGO Dimensions are small 2x4 or 1x2 or even 1x4 bricks, plates, tiles, single studs and 1x1 plates with clips on the end or bars and other smaller elements found commonly in sets. Unique elements specific to certain creatures or vehicle builds can be found, but for the most part it’s all fairly common. But still useful for MOC enthusiasts.

Minifigures

Harry Potter: Dressed in his Gryffindor Uniform, Harry shares printing with some past Minifigures though I believe the detail has been improved slightly since the older details seen in 2010 when Harry Potter was last revived. He has a messy hair sculpt which I believe was first introduced in said 2010 re-launch and his Toy Tag features the Gryffindor colours with a lightning symbol and the lion banner. Harry looks great, this Team Pack does not feature the new wand element though, but with so many spares you can replace it if you so choose.

Lord Voldemort: This entire figure is a re-release of the one found in the smallest set from 2011 or 2010, the one which I reviewed previously since it was one of the only ones I had. It included Hagrid, Narcissa and Voldemort. The printing and details on this figure are identical to that set so the only unique element for this figure is the Toy Tag with its Ouroboros inspired Nagini print. A nice re-release, but nothing stands out as unique.

The build

Enchanted Car: The initial build for Harry’s vehicle is the Weasley family car, enchanted of course by Arthur Weasley and first seen in Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets. This model gives us a very nice little build to show off the design of the vehicle in question.

Shark Sub: When you take the car apart you can build this mish-mash looking thing that is decidedly not a shark. It doesn’t even look like the profile of a shark, but the build is easy enough to follow along with on the screen.

Monstrous Mouth: This final model you can build out of an enchanted car turns the vehicle into a giant monstrous beast. Possibly a nod to the Monster Book of Monsters… but the model is a bit eh. It’s interesting as you build it, but once you see the finished product you might question why such a thing needed to exist.

Hogwarts Express: This is one of the best models in the entire series. It looks great next to Doc Brown’s Time Train also. With a very simple amount of parts you can build this fun little model, and the build was my favorite out of the entire set.

Steam Warrior: A giant robot is what you’re building here, though giant is misleading as the parts to use are sadly minimal in nature. The build is interesting I’ll grant you, but a tad underwhelming while you work on it.

Soaring Steam Plane: In keeping with another train build you can rebuild Hogwarts’ Express into a flying machine. A very weakly designed and implemented flying machine, the stubby nubby wings look terrible and this build is just not as engaging as some of the others.

The completed model

Enchanted Car & Alternate Builds: As I noted above the car is great, the shark sub suffers from lacking any kind of dorsal fin or really anything that makes it look even remotely like a shark. It’s more like one of those Muppet Aliens from Sesame Street that always spoke so oddly and had huge gaping mouths that flapped open and close constantly.

The third model is a bit more interesting, but still has some questionable design choices due to the nature of having to use all of the parts of the car in the build. The wheels in particular are just too obvious and don’t really look like anything else than car tires stuck acting as very circular eyebrows.

Hogwarts Express & Alternate Builds: Hogwarts Express is perfect, this is the best of the three models associated with Lord Voldemort. The colours work well together and it’s nice to have a miniature version of the Express train. The Steam Warrior just looks goofy, it doesn’t match the in-game model at all, some parts are clearly missing and others have been substituted from the train build to try and match what the designers wanted. I’d say the in-game version is much better than what you have physically, and maybe trying to MOC a version of that model would look better.

The Soaring Steam Plane is just bad, the ‘wings’ are too short, the propeller is ugly and again the in-game model makes this look much better than what you get physically. A true shame because the ideas behind these alternate models are interesting, the execution could use a bit more work though.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: This is a great Adventure World, you can explore Hogwarts Castle, Little Whinnying, Grimauld Place and many other areas of Wizarding Britain in one world. I did not notice any glitches or problems in this world.

Battle Arena: Hogwarts Quidditch Arena by Moonlight is where you can battle three of your friends.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Harry has Water Spray, Target, Laser Deflection, Diffindo, Flying, Illumination, Stealth, Magic, Parseltongue Doors, Apparate Access and can Destroy Silver LEGO Objects. The Enchanted Car can use Accelerator Switches, Tow-Bar, Flight Docks and Flight Cargo Hooks. The Shark Sub can access Underwater Drone, Underwater Interactions and Sonar Smash. The Monstrous Mouth can Vine Cut and somehow Destroy Gold LEGO Objects.

Voldemort can use a large selection of the same abilities as Harry. His only unique power is Mind Control. The Hogwarts Express can use Accelerator Switches, Sonar Smash and Tow-Bar. The Steam Warrior has a Special Attack and Guardian Ability as well as Super Jump and can destroy Cracked LEGO Objects. The Soaring Steam Plane can Destroy Gold LEGO Objects, use Tow-Bar, Flight Docks, Flight Cargo Hooks and has the Special Attack ability.

Overall opinion

As a fan of LEGO Harry Potter I’d recommend this set strongly to anyone interested in revisiting the Theme in the LEGO Dimensions video game. It’s a must own set as well to gain access to the Battle Arena and Adventure World. Highly Recommended.
